Alan Dean schrieb:
> On 3/9/07, Julian Reschke <julian.reschke@...> wrote:
>> [snip]
>> And since when is Location a request header?
> 
> Yes, I don't like the idea of using a response header in a request.
> 
> I suppose you could use Content-Location:
> 
> http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.14
> 
> But even so, that leaves unanswered the question of how the client
> tells the server if the redirect is temporary or permanent. It is
> this, more than anything else, which gets to the heart of my original
> question. I can only see a POST|PUT of a representation of the
> redirect itself (formatted as message/http or possibly
> application/rdf+xml using the HTTP RDFS) as being a viable solution to
> this question. It is not simply a question of giving the server a
> location URI.

Well, or use a new method with well-defined semantics, such as defined 
in <http://greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/rfc4437.html#METHOD_MKREDIRECTREF>.

Best regards, Julian
